medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant pain with radiation to the back and nausea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began when the patient awoke with pain in the right back, worsening to include right upper quadrant pain. Pain was at its worst at the beginning and currently has decreased. The patient denies changes with food or body position or inspiration. Associated nausea, with one episode of vomiting after CT oral contrast in the ED. No prior episodes of similar symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Type 2 diabetes mellitus (insulin dependent) 2. Hypertension 3. Hyperlipidemia 4. Obesity 5. Asthma 6. Chronic renal insufficiency 7. History of pulmonary embolism 8. Status post appendectomy 9. Obstructive sleep apnea on CPAP.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with renal cancer; father with diabetes mellitus; grandmother with diabetes mellitus.
medical_history.social_history: Current tobacco user; last alcohol consumption was 2 weeks ago (vodka and orange juice at a party).
